questions:
1) Trees have a thick, brown and woody stem called *trunk*.

2) *Shrubs* are also called bushes.

3) *Creepers* are weak plants that mostly grow along the ground.

4) *Bamboo* is the tallest grass.

5) *Herbs* are used as medicines or to add flavor to food.

metadata.title: Q9- Fill in the blanks with the correct answers.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio
Your browser does not support this audio
Your browser does not support this audio
Your browser does not support this audio
Your browser does not support this audio

Your browser does not support this audio
Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Click on the information buttons to revise what you studied.

Flowers are the reproductive part of plants. They often have
showy petals and fragrances to attract pollinators such as birds, bees, and other insects.

Roots anchor the plants in the soil and absorb nutrients and
water that are needed by the rest of the plant.
Stems support the upper part of the plant and act as a transport system for nutrients, water, sugar, and starches.
Seeds contain plant material that can develop into another plant. Seeds are covered with a protective seed coat and have one or two cotyledons.

Fruits are the fleshy substances that usually surround seeds.
They protect the seeds and attract animals to eat them.
Leaves are the green parts of the plant where photosynthesis usually occurs - where food for the plant is made.

questions:
1) *Flowers* are the reproductive parts of plants.

2) *Roots* absorb water and nutrients from the soil.

3) *Fruits* protect the seeds of plants.

4) *Stems* support the upper part of the plant.

5) *Leaves* are the green part where photosynthesis occurs.

6) *Seeds* develop into another new plant.

metadata.title: Q14- Read the question and choose the correct answer.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
It is the correct answer.
 
Explanation:
 
Most plants do not need to eat. Plants use photosynthesis to make sugar. This sugar is food for plants. Plants use energy from the sugar to grow.
 
Plants do not eat minerals or soil. Plants take in minerals from the soil, but the minerals do not give them energy to grow. Plants use minerals to keep their bodies healthy.

answers.text: Nothing. Plants make sugar. They use energy from the sugar to grow.
Minerals. Plants use energy from the minerals to grow.
Soil. Plants use energy from the soil to grow.

overallFeedback.feedback: Excellent ! It is the correct answer.

metadata.title: Q18- Read the question and choose the correct answer.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

choices.question: Which statement is true about fruit?
answers:
Most fruit has seeds inside. The seeds can grow into new plants.

Most fruit has pollen inside. The pollen can grow into new flowers.

Most fruit has roots inside. The roots can grow into new leaves.

overallFeedback.feedback: Brilliant ! It is the correct answer.

metadata.title: Q19- Read the question and choose the correct answer.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
It is the correct answer.
 
Explanation:
 
Pollen helps the flower make seeds. Pollen can be moved to the female part of the flower. Then, the flower can make seeds. Pollen does not help a plant grow bigger or grow leaves.

overallFeedback.feedback: Fantastic ! It is the correct answer.

questions:
1) *Water/Aquatic* plants grow in water.

2) Bamboo is an example of *grass*.

3) *Roots* absorb nutrients and water from the soil.

4) *Oxygen* is a waste product plant release from photosynthesis.

5) *Seeds* can come in many shapes, colors, and sizes which make new plants.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
It is the correct answer.
 
Explanation:
 
Germination happens when a seed begins to grow into a new plant. The new plant may grow leaves, but this is not called germination.
 
When pollen lands on the female part of a flower, it is called pollination.

answers.text: a seed begins to grow into a new plant.
pollen lands on the female part of a flower.

overallFeedback.feedback: Amazing ! It is the correct answer.

params.question: Do plants need carbon dioxide for photosynthesis?

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
It is the correct answer.
 
Explanation:
 
Plants do not need soil for photosynthesis. For photosynthesis, plants need water, carbon dioxide, and light. During photosynthesis, plants use energy from light to turn water and carbon dioxide into sugar.

overallFeedback.feedback: Brilliant ! It is the correct answer.

params.text: Which part of the beet plant do we usually eat?

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
It is the correct answer.
 
Explanation:
 
The part of the beet plant we usually eat is the root. It takes in water and nutrients. It also holds the plant in place in the soil.
